61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:34): lol. if you call webkitIndexedDB.open() with no parameters, it creates a database with the 9-character name "undefined"
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:35): is there some magic IDL parameter to say "treat undefined as null" or something?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:35): Thyat sounds like expected behaviour in js at least
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:35): (we already handle open(null) properly)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:35): Yeah I think there is some IDL magic one can wave
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:35): 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19: Do you plan to contribute your tests to the WG btw?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:36): You should make time permit :)
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:36): my manager is very webkit-focused
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:38): I thought everyone at google believed that what's good for the web is good for Google
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:38): my objectives this quarter have been very webkit-centric

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:39): You should charge the time to the other departments who won't have to spend their time working around bugs in other browsers that your tests would have caught
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:39): i'll push for some time to port these tests in Q3
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:40): i've already been wrapping webkit-specific prefixes on variable names and such
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:40): has the testing WG settled on a framework yet?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:41): For javascript tests we seem to be using testharness.js
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:41): Which you used for some video tests iirc
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:41): i ported those to webkit, btw
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:41): wrapped 'em like we wrapped philip's canvas tests
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:41): to make them work as LayoutTests
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:42): In some generic way?
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:42): yes, just had a change the script tags
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:42): Which script tags?
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:42): it was a generic testharness.js-to-LayoutTests wrapper
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:43): There is a not-very-well-enforced requirement to add a <script src="/resources/testharnessreport.js"></script> in testharness.js files
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:43): the ones that pointed to ../../../../testharness.js
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:43): So that vendors can put whatever random code they need to integrate with testharness.js in testharnessreport.js
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:45): [Undefined=Null, Null=Null] attribute DOMString owner;
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:46): 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19: BTW if you have an webkit followup on http://www.w3.org/mid/<email/> it would be very interesting
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:48): looks like webkit needs that IDL magic on basically every non-optional non-nullable argument on every method
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (17:49): that seems like an odd default behavior for IDL
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:49): Speak to heycam|away
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:49): http://www.w3.org/TR/2008/WD-WebIDL-20081219/#Undefined has a very clear example that perfectly illustrates the behavior i'm seeing in webkit
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (17:49): 61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19: JS is sane! Just, uh, not host objects‚Ä¶
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:50): shit, i'm looking at an old copy of the spec
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:50): it's now http://www.w3.org/TR/WebIDL/#TreatUndefinedAs
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:51): Hmm, the one on /TR/ shouldn't be the newest one
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:51): You want the one on dev.w3.org
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:52): ok, no change: http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/WebIDL/#TreatUndefinedAs
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:53): ok, now i have two problems
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:53): [TreatUndefinedAs=Null] can only be used on DOMString attributes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:53): notes again how awesome the W3C dated URLs are
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:54): but i have "any" attributes that also need this behavior
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:54): wonders if webkit enforces that rule anyway
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (17:55): wonders what systems b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea would take for unique identifiers
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:57): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167: I would make that URL http://specs.w3.org/WebIDL
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:57): Or something
61831986744b882b4371990cc1863b19 (17:57): no, i take it back, the "any" parameters are behaving themselves already
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:58): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167, put the latest version of WebIDL at that URL forever.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:58): Why would anyone want an obsolete version anyway?
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (17:59): well 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 it is what /TR/shortname is somehow. with a different notion of last version.
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (17:59): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I'm interested by older versions.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:59): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167: http://sepcs.w3.org/WebIDL/{revison-id}
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (17:59): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167, then you can spend slightly more effort to find them.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:00): Way too many people wind up looking at useless, obsolete versions of specs in the current W3C setup.
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:00): two different issues.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:00): But yeah, you can always just use a path.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:00): After the revision.
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:00): the pattern for naming the document
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:00): the findability of the document
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:01): Like just have it take a date or revision id and show you what the version was at that time.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:01): Or, really, just set up hgweb or ViewVC or whatever so people can look at the changelog.
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:01): Maybe when a specification has been replaced by a newer version, there should be a robots.txt for removing it from search engines crawling
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (18:02): question: do mouseover/mouseout events bubble by default in the current spec?
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (18:03): also: this line often sets a channel into a spiral of fun that simply can't be stopped: http://rodgercombs.webhop.net/maps/freenode/whatwg/current/
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:05): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: http://specs.w3.org/WebIDL/{revison-id}  would be the last commit?
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:06): let me rephrase that
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:06): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: http://specs.w3.org/WebIDL/  would be the last commit
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (18:06): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: http://specs.w3.org/WebIDL/{revison-id}  would be the revision-id commit?

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:17): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167: (and it could even cope with multiple versions and things because you could have e.g. spec.w3.org/html/5/ which would be a tag or branch in the underlying repository)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:18): (depends on 5 not being a valid rev. id of course)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:18): (but one could make up a name somehow)
